text: Ellen Evangeline Hovick (known as June Havoc; November 8, 1912 â€“ March 28, 2010) was a Canadian-born American actress, dancer, author and a theater director. She acted in many stage plays and movies. She began on Broadway, appearing in plays including Pal Joey. She later moved to Hollywood and began acting in movies. Her first movie was Gentleman's Agreement. She last appeared on the television series General Hospital in 1990. Havoc was born in Vancouver, British Columbia. Her sister was Gypsy Rose Lee. Their father was Norwegian-American. She died in Stamford, Connecticut at 97. == Other websites == * Category:Actors from Vancouver Category:American television actors Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:1912 births Category:2010 deaths
title: June Havoc
